sentences.sContent: I had been peering at a computer print-out that made no sense at all.
sentences.sCn: 我一直在费力地看一份不知所云的电脑打印稿。

sentences.sContent: ...it is more likely to think independently or at least see people outside of the economics profession as forming their peer group...
...making process has been undermined by stress or peer pressure...

words.tran: 无与伦比的；出类拔萃的；无比的
（全体）贵族；贵族地位；贵族阶级
有爵位的妇女；贵族夫人
窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫

trans.tranOther: If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly

trans.tranCn: 同龄人，同等地位的人；贵族
trans.tranOther: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc
